qas.question: What political problem did Montini feel he needed to address as a diplomat in Poland?
How did Montini see the nationalism of Poland as a problem?
What humanitarian concept did Montini see nationalism as violating?
What type of political stability was compromised as a result of violent nationalism?
Where was Montini happy to return to after his tenure in Poland?

context: The only foreign diplomatic experience Montini underwent was his time in the nunciature in Warsaw, Poland in 1923. Like Achille Ratti before him,[a] he felt confronted with the huge problem, not limited to Poland, of <a0_0>excessive nationalism<a0_0/>: "This form of nationalism <a1_0>treats foreigners as enemies<a1_0/>, especially foreigners with whom one has <a2_0>common frontiers<a2_0/>. Then one seeks the expansion of one's own country at the expense of the immediate neighbours. People grow up with a feeling of being hemmed in. <a3_0>Peace<a3_0/> becomes a transient compromise between wars." When he was recalled to <a4_0>Rome<a4_0/> he was happy to go, because "this concludes this episode of my life, which has provided useful, though not always joyful, experiences."
